thread.title: NHL: Caps' Alex Ovechkin admits to missing practice
thread.title_full: NHL: Caps' Alex Ovechkin admits to missing practice

title: NHL: Caps' Alex Ovechkin admits to missing practice
text:
Buy this photo 
Washington Capitals star Alex Ovechkin said he overslept and missed practice Tuesday morning, and that's why coach Barry Trotz made him sit out that night's 5-0 home loss to the San Jose Sharks. 
The Capitals said Tuesday that Ovechkin missed the game due to "personal reasons." Ovechkin spoke to reporters after Wednesday's practice, saying he made a mistake setting his alarm clock. 
He said he set the alarm clock for 8:30 p.m. instead of a.m., which caused him to oversleep and arrive at practice late. Ovechkin said Trotz then told the team captain he would not play in the game for violating team rules. 
"I just messed up with my alarm clock ... made a mistake," Ovechkin said. "We talked. We have a conversation. It's [the] rules." 
Trotz said he understood what happened, but the rules are the rules. 
"It was an honest mistake," Trotz said. "But we have certain accountability rules, and everyone's accountable in that room." 
FLYERS 3, BLACKHAWKS 0 (at Philadelphia) — Michal Neuvirth made 30 saves to black Chicago. 
Sam Gagner and Claude Giroux scored second-period goals to make it 2-0. 
Matt Reed capped the scoring with 2:35 remaining in the game. 
SENATORS 7, BLUE JACKETS 3 (at Columbus) — Bobby Ryan, Mika Zibanejad and Kyle Turris each had a goal and an assist, Erik Karlsson added a career-high four assists for Ottawa. 
Marc Methot, Milan Michalek, Jean-Gabriel Pageau and Mike Hoffman also scored to help Ottawa improve to 3-0-0 on the road for the first time since 2007-08. Ryan Stone had two assists and Craig Anderson made 37 saves.
